title: Construction Investment Dashboard
about_text:
This interactive dashboard analyzes long-term construction investment trends in Japan using historical economic data. The objective is to understand how investments evolved over time and how resources are distributed between sectors, construction types, and public versus private participation.

The application highlights key macroeconomic indicators such as total investment growth, the balance between architecture and civil engineering, government versus private sector participation, and shifts between residential, industrial, and renovation activities.

Built with Python, Pandas, Plotly, and Streamlit, this project demonstrates how data analysis can be transformed into an interactive data product that supports economic and infrastructure insights.
gov_vs_private: Government vs Private Investment Over Time
res_vs_nonres: Residential vs Non-Residential Construction Over Time
industry: Private Investment in Mining & Industry Over Time
repairs: Renovation vs New Construction Over Time
